instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGD? ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present when PP1V8_S3, PP5V_S3, PP1V2_S3, PP1V05_S0, PP5V_S0, PP3V3_S0, & PP1V5_S0 are present and working. If any of these rails is not working, ALL_SYS_PWRGD will be pulled down and the machine will not turn on. .
definitions.PP5V_S0: What is PP5V_S0? PP5V_S0 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S0 working state..
definitions.PP3V3_S0: What is PP3V3_S0? The "PP3V3_S0" rail in a MacBook logic board is a power rail that supplies 3.3 volts to the system when it is fully awake (S0 state). .
definitions.P3V3S3_EN: What is P3V3S3_EN? P3V3S3_EN is a signal that turns on the PP3V3_S3 power rail when it is high. Signals with _EN on the end enable whatever came before the _EN if the signal is high. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> beeping 3 times
threads.message: This board had problems on an 3v3 S3 line, that was fixed, it turned on and was beeping 3 times (as when you have a RAM problem). I decieded to reprogram the BIOS and now I get the same 3 beeps but as if it was a problem with the BIOS... it goes up to .410 A but does nothing. Never had a similar problem... please help!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> beeping 3 times
threads.message:
Not many RAM chips there.
Worth to reball them.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> beeping 3 times
threads.message:
Just reballed the ram chips, no change.
The 3 beeps have space of around 3 seconds between each. According to me that means BIOS, but the I have tried 3 different bios from vinafix and it is not working... any advice?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> beeping 3 times
threads.message:
I bet we have some clean ME BIOS posted for that board on the forum.
If you cannot find it, try this.
[URL unfurl="true"]https://drive.google.com/file/d/18m-YhIlNhX4Uf5njH8KHmRGZelvEXnD_/view?usp=sharing[/URL]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> beeping 3 times
threads.message: What makes you suspect BIOS if you get RAM beeps? It's not impossible but it's much more likely to be something up with RAM power rails (VTT…), RAM reset signal, RAM itself, a random knocked off component (RCOMP or VREF resistors…), CPU or a broken trace/via for example.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> beeping 3 times
threads.message:
Pregunta:
si inyecto voltaje en <SIGNAL>P3V3S3_EN</SIGNAL> puedo dañar algo?
quitando <TRANSISTOR>Q8150</TRANSISTOR> <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> me daba un voltaje de 1.8V, por lo que inyecte voltaje en las lineas <SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL>, tuve que reemplazar <CHIP>U8080</CHIP> porque se estaba calentando, despues inyecté en <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL> y no encontré corto, por último en <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S3</SIGNAL> y se calentaba <CHIP>U8010</CHIP>, retirando <CHIP>U8010</CHIP> el consumo en la linea desapareció, pero después de cambiarlo seguia teniendo un consumo, por lo que intente inyectar voltaje en <SIGNAL>P3V3S3_EN</SIGNAL>, lo cual me llevó a <CHIP>U7820</CHIP> y PCH ya me había pasado antes y habíamos concluido que el procesador está muerto.
Ahora en este caso, después de hacer todo eso, de nuevo tengo los 3 beeps que indican problemas con memoria Ram, te agradecería me ayudes a encontrarle sentido a este caso.

Saludos

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> beeping 3 times
threads.message:
Compare diode mode reading at DDR power rail with good board.
Replace RAM chips; if no change, then probably bad CPU...
